com.bluegosling.tuples

Interface Tuple.Ops1<A>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<Object>, Tuple
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Tuple.Ops2<A,B>, Tuple.Ops3<A,B,C>, Tuple.Ops4<A,B,C,D>, Tuple.Ops5<A,B,C,D,E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NTuple, Pair, Quartet, Quintet, Trio, Unit
    Enclosing interface:
    Tuple

    public static interface Tuple.Ops1<A>
extends Tuple
    Operations supported by tuples that have at least one element.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.bluegosling.tuples.Tuple

        Tuple.Ops1<A>, Tuple.Ops2<A,B>, Tuple.Ops3<A,B,C>, Tuple.Ops4<A,B,C,D>, Tuple.Ops5<A,B,C,D,E>

    • Method Detail

      • getFirst

        A getFirst()
        Retrieves the first item in the tuple.
        Returns:
        the first item in the tuple

      • setFirst

        <T> Tuple.Ops1<T> setFirst(T t)
        Sets the first item in the tuple. Since tuples are immutable, this returns a new tuple with the first item changed.
        Parameters:
        t - the new item
        Returns:
        a new tuple with the first item set to the specified new item

      • removeFirst

        Tuple removeFirst()
        Removes the first item from the tuple. Since tuples are immutable, this returns a new tuple with one less item.
        Returns:
        a new tuple with the same items as this tuple except that the first item is removed

      • add

        <T> Tuple.Ops2<A,?> add(T t)
        Description copied from interface: Tuple
        Adds a new item to this tuple. The item will be appended and thus ordered last in the new tuple. Since tuples are immutable, a new tuple is returned with the same items as this tuple but with the specified item added to the end.
        Specified by:
        add in interface Tuple
        Parameters:
        t - the item to add
        Returns:
        a new tuple that is the specified item appended to this tuple

      • insertFirst

        <T> Tuple.Ops2<T,A> insertFirst(T t)
        Description copied from interface: Tuple
        Adds an item into the first position of this tuple. Existing items are shifted over so the first item in this tuple is the second item in the returned tuple. Since tuples are immutable, a new tuple is returned with the same items as this tuple but with the specified item inserted as the first item.
        Specified by:
        insertFirst in interface Tuple
        Parameters:
        t - the item to insert
        Returns:
        a new tuple that is the specified item followed by the items in this tuple

      • insertSecond

        <T> Tuple.Ops2<A,T> insertSecond(T t)
        Inserts an item into the second position of this tuple. Since tuples are immutable, this returns a new tuple with one more item.

        If this tuple has only one item then this is the same as calling add(Object). Otherwise, this will insert an item after the first item but before the second.

        Parameters:
        t - the new item
        Returns:
        a new tuple with the same items as this tuple except the specified new item is inserted as the second item in the tuple

      • transformAll

        <T> Tuple.Ops1<T> transformAll(Function<Object,? extends T> function)
        Description copied from interface: Tuple
        Transforms every item in this tuple by applying the specified function to each one. Since tuples are immutable, a new tuple is returned. The returned tuple will have the same number of items as this tuple.
        Specified by:
        transformAll in interface Tuple
        Parameters:
        function - the function to apply
        Returns:
        a new tuple that is the result of applying the specified function to all elements of this tuple

      • transformFirst

        <T> Tuple.Ops1<T> transformFirst(Function<? super A,? extends T> function)
        Transforms the first item in the tuple using the specified function. Other items in the tuple are unchanged. Since tuples are immutable, this returns a new tuple.
        Parameters:
        function - the function to apply
        Returns:
        a new tuple with the first item set to the result of applying the specified function to the first item in this tuple
